question: Which was the first mutant IDH2 inhibitor to be approved for patients with acute myeloid leukemia?
ideal_answer: Enasidenib was the first mutant IDH2 inhibitor to be approved for the treatment of refractory and relapsed acute myeloid leukemia.

snippets.text: Enasidenib: First Mutant IDH2 Inhibitor for the Treatment of Refractory and Relapsed Acute Myeloid Leukemia.
The various findings about enasidenib revealed that it has been designed to allosterically inhibit mutated IDH2 to treat R/R AML patients

Enasidenib or AG-221was introduced by FDA as an anticancer agent which was developed as a first in class, a selective allosteric inhibitor of the tumor target i.e. IDH2 for Relapsed or Refractory AML.
